prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector set to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Creating the Sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle using the four given line segments. The lines are: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.6429) - Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.6429) and ending at (0.0, 0.6429) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.6429) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) 3. Draw a second rectangle inside the first one, using the four given line segments. The lines are: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0536, 0.0536) and ending at (0.6964, 0.0536) - Line 2: Starting at (0.6964, 0.0536) and ending at (0.6964, 0.5893) - Line 3: Starting at (0.6964, 0.5893) and ending at (0.0536, 0.5893) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0536, 0.5893) and ending at (0.0536, 0.0536) The resulting sketch should have two rectangles, one inside the other. Creating the Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch by 0.0536 units in the normal direction. 3. Set the "operation" parameter to "NewBodyFeatureOperation". Part 2 Instructions Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector set to (0.3141, 0.0536, 0.0). Creating the Sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle using the four given line segments. The lines are: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.0536, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.0536, 0.0) and ending at (0.0536, 0.5357) - Line 3: Starting at (0.0536, 0.5357) and ending at (0.0, 0.5357) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.5357) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) The resulting sketch should be a rectangle with a flat top and bottom. Creating the Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.5357. 2. Extrude the sketch by 0.0536 units in the normal direction. 3. Set the "operation" parameter to "JoinFeatureOperation". The final shape will be a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units.</description>
